solution_line_template: In the first week, each day they pack {apples_per_box}*{full_boxes_per_day} = <<{apples_per_box}*{full_boxes_per_day}={apples_packed_per_day_week1}>>{apples_packed_per_day_week1} apples

The total number of apples packed in the boxes is {apples_packed_per_day_week1}*{days_in_week} = <<{apples_packed_per_day_week1}*{days_in_week}={total_apples_week1}>>{total_apples_week1} apples in the first week.

When {fewer_apples_per_day_week2} fewer apples were packed each day in the next week, the total became {apples_packed_per_day_week1}-{fewer_apples_per_day_week2} = <<{apples_packed_per_day_week1}-{fewer_apples_per_day_week2}={apples_packed_per_day_week2}>>{apples_packed_per_day_week2} apples per day.

The total number of apples packed in the boxes that week is {apples_packed_per_day_week2}*{days_in_week} = <<{apples_packed_per_day_week2}*{days_in_week}={total_apples_week2}>>{total_apples_week2} apples.
The total is {total_apples_week1}+{total_apples_week2} = <<{total_apples_week1}+{total_apples_week2}={total_apples_two_weeks}>>{total_apples_two_weeks} apples for the two weeks
